title: Are conspiracy theorists really agents of the Illuminati sent to discredit their own theories by telling them to people? - Quora

response.answer_text: I know they sound so logical until you look into it. I actually believe Mk ultra, mockingbird, paperclip, gladiato, phoenix program, Iran/contra, drone strikes, Watergate etc were real until I jumped on David ikes site and read about lizard people now I know it was all made up by conspiracy theory nut jobs. I feel like such a fool.

That's a bit convoluted. Superficially, let me say that some cases are bad, some not but sound weird. However, there are those who try to discredit good conspiracy explanatory theory. Some are corporate, some government, some occultist, some all three. Mostly, though, doubters are as incompetent as bad conspiracy case workers, and not formal agents of disinformation, just agents in the original sense of action (“agency” means action) helping cover up. Ok? Good luck learning more.
“Are conspiracy theorists really agents of the Illuminati sent to discredit their own theories by telling them to people?” Sounds like you have your own conspiracy theory going on.
There is a logic this theory, however as it is also a conspiracy theory, it raises the possibility that you are an agent of the illuminati, sent to discredit this theory.
A fantastic demonstration of the inherent problem with conspiracy theories. Problems with a conspiracy theory can always be answered with another conspiracy theory.

While this question sounds like a joke, I will answer it seriously. Yes, there are shills, psy-ops, and controlled opposition. A few good examples of this is: David Icke, Alex Jones, Flat Earth, and much more.
There is a lot of controlled opposition, so yes there are wolves in sheep's clothing.
